intro: Scorzonera taraxacifolium, commonly known as the dandelion-leaved scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and cylindrical stems. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves with a waxy coating, and its flowers are yellow, resembling those of the dandelion. Scorzonera taraxacifolium is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
